en.ta-v1-index-modal: A rapidly deployed critical data & visualization intervention in the USA‚Äôs 2018 ‚ÄúZero Tolerance Policy‚Äù for asylum seekers at the US Ports of Entry and the humanitarian crisis that has followed.
en.ta-requested-page-could-not-be-found: The requested page could not be found.
en.ta-v1-clinks-legend-supp-text: We are not showing the addresses of ICE facilities currently not in use. However, this is the full landscape of incarceration for those deemed without papers.
en.ta-v1-trap-legend: The border is a trap. Begun in 2005, [Operation Streamline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Streamline) has criminalized border crossing. Authorized ports of entry, tiny holes shown here as 15-miles wide, [turn back asylum seekers](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/at-the-us-border-asylum-seekers-fleeing-violence-are-told-to-come-back-later/2018/06/12/79a12718-6e4d-11e8-afd5-778aca903bbe_story.html?utm_term=.1caf2e540b8c), pushing them into the [100-mile-wide border zone](https://www.aclu.org/other/constitution-100-mile-border-zone), where they are exposed to harsh conditions from both the environment and law enforcement.
en.ta-v1-orr-legend: As of November 2017, the [Office of Refugee Resettlement](https://www.acf.hhs.gov/orr) has 113 redacted sites which reportedly average daily populations greater than zero. Each site is related to a Docket Control Office, which lets us guess more or less where each site is, at least at the scale you see here. But these sites are sneaky and always slip out of view.
en.ta-v1-time-series-text: This shows the numbers of detained persons over the last four years of data. Our effort here is in line with other efforts at quantification.
en.ta-v1-adp-text: ADP is the Average Daily Population and represents someone in ICE detention. However, this is as fungible a number as any other and depends on Congressional language for ‚Äúbeds.‚Äù
en.ta-v1-bookins-text: The initial book-ins into detention facilities rate
en.ta-v1-operators-text: The facility can be operated by ICE, GEO, MVM, CCA or other contractors
en.ta-v1-mandays-definition: The sum of midnight count mandays for a facility for all days in the fiscal year.
en.ta-v1-usage-definition: Indicates the percentage of fiscal year days in use to date.
en.ta-v1-18-adp-by-operator: Portion of Total Average Daily Population per Operator
en.ta-v1-banned-legend: The population of this ephemeral, blackened country of closed borders is about _N%_ of that of the excluded majority Muslim population banned from entering the US by [Presidential Proclamation 9645](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executive_Order_13780#Presidential_Proclamation_9645).
en.ta-v2-lines-legend: ICE removed over 220,000 people in the United States in 2017. Each person was removed through a port of entry, or, more appropriately, a port of removal. The lines represent this stream of re-displaced people.
en.ta-female-owned-contractors: Businesses owned by women who have not also designated a minority category
en.ta-dollars-out-of-N-in-ICE-awards-since-: out of $N in ICE awards since 2014
en.ta-v2-piechart-description: This visualization identifies contractors certified as belonging to protected categories. The bar charts on the left show the number of minority-owned businesses on top and the number of women-owned businesses (both minority and not) below. The bar charts on the right represent the corresponding populations based on how much money these contractors have received from ICE since 2014.
en.ta-allies-supp-text: Our list of allies has been double-vetted for trustworthiness
en.ta-allies-curated-list: The list below was curated by our research team and is by no means exhaustive.
en.ta-ice-money-since-2013: Cumulative ICE awards since 2014 to contractors by congressional district
en.ta-v2-the-flow-of-bodies-and-goods: The Flow of Bodies and Goods
en.ta-please-make-your-browser-window-talle: Please make your browser window taller and reload to see this visualization.
en.ta-click-on-cube-to-see-contractor: Please click on a cube above to see its contractor.
en.ta-v2-index-modal: Volume 2 of Torn Apart is a deep and radically new look at the territory and infrastructure of ICE‚Äôs financial regime in the USA. This data & visualization intervention peels back layers of culpability behind the humanitarian crisis of 2018.
en.ta-v2-freezer-description: Freezer examines the cold banalities of ICE through connections between products, contractors, and subsidiaries. Our categorization schema highlights the interplay of ideological and physical control behind ICE: Staples, Doctrine, Machines, The Threat of Violence, Reforming Bodies, Surveillance, The Flow of Bodies and Goods, Walls, and Mixed Bag. ‚ÄúMurderboard‚Äù depicts these as an ‚Äúevidence board,‚Äù where scraps of data are linked with string. Click on a sticky note to scroll through contracts. ‚ÄúICE Tray‚Äù presents this data as a tree map. Hover over the rectangles to see category, product, and contractor names; click on them to scroll through contract data; or click "play."
en.ta-bibliography-description: Below is a list of our data sources. For a larger list of sources please visit our open [Zotero group](https://www.zotero.org/groups/2199147/hummingbird/). For a larger scholarly bibliography, we recommend the open [#ImmigrationSyllabus](http://editions.lib.umn.edu/immigrationsyllabus/) by the Immigration History Research Center at the University of Minnesota and the Immigration and Ethnic History Society. You can access most of our data in our [Open Data Repository on GitHub](https://github.com/xpmethod/torn-apart-open-data).
en.ta-iphone-se-alert: Visualizations may appear distorted in this browser window.
en.ta-iphone-se-apology: Despite our best efforts to ensure a useful experience with our visualizations on any device, your browser window is too small for the visualizations to render properly.

es.ta-v1-clinks-legend-supp-text: Representaci√≥n de la infrastructura de encarcelaci√≥n de inmigrantes en EE. UU.
es.ta-v1-trap-legend: La frontera es una trampa. Desde 2005, [Operation Streamline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Streamline) ha criminalizado el cruce fronterizo. Los puertos de entrada autorizados, mostrados aqu√≠ como peque√±os huecos de 15 millas, [rechazan los solicitantes de asilo](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/at-the-us-border-asylum-seekers-fleeing-violence-are-told-to-come-back-later/2018/06/12/79a12718-6e4d-11e8-afd5-778aca903bbe_story.html?utm_term=.1caf2e540b8c) y los empujan hacia [la zona fronteriza de 100 millas](https://www.aclu.org/other/constitution-100-mile-border-zone) donde condiciones duras del medio ambiente y de ICE los oprimen.
es.ta-v1-orr-legend: Desde noviembre del 2017 la [Oficina de Relocalizaci√≥n de Refugiados](https://www.acf.hhs.gov/orr) tiene 113 sitios redactados donde reportan poblaci√≥n diaria mayor de cero. Cada sitio est√° relacionado a la Oficina de Control de Casos, lo que nos deja saber m√°s o mendos donde est√°n estos sitios, al menos en la escala que ven aqu√≠. Pero estos sitios son rebalosos y desaparecen de vista.
es.ta-v1-time-series-text: N√∫mero de personas detenidas basado en datos de los ultimo 4 a√±os. Nuestro esfuerzo es similar a otros similares.
es.ta-v1-adp-text: ADP es la promedio Poblaci√≥n Diaria y representa a alguien en detenci√≥n de ICE. Sinembargo, este n√∫mero es relativo y depende de la definici√≥n del congreso de una ‚Äúcama‚Äù.

UU. por [Proclamaci√≥n presidencial 9645](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executive_Order_13780#Presidential_Proclamation_9645).

es.ta-v2-lines-legend: ICE expulso a m√°s de 220,000 personas en los EE.UU. en 2017. Cada persona fue expulsada por un puerto de desembarque, o mejor dicho, por un puerto de expulsi√≥n. Las lineas representan el flujo de personas re-desplazadas.

es.ta-dollars-out-of-N-in-ICE-awards-since-: de $N en contratos de ICE desde el 2014
es.ta-v2-piechart-description: Esta secci√≥n identifica recipientes de contratos que se identifican como pertenecientes a grupos minoritarios. Estos dos gr√°ficos de barras dividen dos categor√≠as basandose en dos variables diferentes. En el primero, mostramos el n√∫mero de negocios de propiedad minoriatria por encima de negocios propiedad de mujer (minoritaria o no). En el segundo, calculamos las mismas categor√≠as pero basadas en la cantidad de dinero recibido de ICE desde 2014 por los negocios.

es.ta-v2-index-modal: El Volumen 2 de Separados presenta una manera profunda y radicalmente nueva al territorio e infraestructura del regimen financiero de ICE en EE.UU. Aqu√≠ pelamos las capas de culpabilidad detr√°s de la crisis humanitaria del 2018.
es.ta-v2-freezer-description: "Congelador" examina la fr√≠a banalidad de ICE a travez de las conexiones entre productos, contratistas, y subsidiarios. Nuestro esquema de categorizaci√≥n resalta el rejuego de control ideol√≥gico y f√≠sico de ICE: Grapas, Doctrina, Maquinas, Vigilancia, La Amenaza de violencia, El Flujo de cuerpos y bienes, Paredes y Mezcla. "Pizarr√≥n" muestra estas categor√≠as como "pizarra de evidencia," donde peque√±os retazos de informaci√≥n se atan con cuerda fina. Haga click en una de las peque√±as notas para ver los contratos. "La Bandeja" representa esta data como un mapa arbol. Acerque el mouse a los rectangulos para ver la categor√≠a, el producto, y el nombre de los contratistas; haga click para ver los contratos en detalle; o simplemente dele a "play."
es.ta-bibliography-description: Aqu√≠ encontraran una lista de nuestras fuentes de datos. Para una lista m√°s amplia visiten nuesto [grupo de Zotero abierto](https://www.zotero.org/groups/2199147/hummingbird/). Para una bibliograf√≠a ac√°demica, recomendamos el [#ImmigrationSyllabus](http://editions.lib.umn.edu/immigrationsyllabus/) de el Immigration History Research Center en la Universidad de Minnesota y el Immigration and Ethnic History Society. "Le cong√©lo" examine la banalit√© froide de l'ICE √† travers les connexions entre les produits, les sous-traitants et les filiales.
